Dispute_Type: Discrimination based on family status and disability
Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission erred in dismissing the complaint on jurisdictional grounds
Evidence_Assessment: Mr. Hicks provided arguments challenging the narrow interpretation of 'dependant'
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show jurisdiction exists
Legal_Rule: Under CHRA s. 41(1)(c), the Commission must deal with complaints unless plainly and obviously beyond its jurisdiction
Procedural_Issue: Dismissal on jurisdictional grounds without full investigation
Grounds_for_Claim: Discrimination on the basis of family status and disability
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Commission failed to adequately consider jurisdiction
Key_Evidence_Considered: Definition of 'dependant' under TDRA Directive, Mr. Hicks's relationship to mother-in-law
Applicant_Challenge: Commission applied too narrow an interpretation of prohibited grounds
Court_Result: Federal Court ordered reconsideration by new decision-maker
Defendant_Response: No response detailed; Commission relied on jurisdictional exclusion
Authority: Canadian Human Rights Commission, Federal Court
Applicable_Process: Complaint → PSLRB appeal → Commission complaint → Judicial review
